<Text: The Obusier de 6 pouces Gribeauval or 6-inch howitzer was a French artillery piece and part of a system established by Jean Baptiste Vaquette de Gribeauval.>
Triplets:<Jean Baptiste Vaquette de Gribeauval
1:
--------------------
Text: Obusier de 6 pouces Gribeauval:  The Old French inch (French: "pouce" ) was actually 1.066 English inches long so the weapon can accurately be described as a 6.4-inch howitzer.
Triplets:<Old French inch
2:
--------------------
Text: Obusier de 6 pouces Gribeauval:  The Gribeauval system included the 6-inch howitzer, the light Canon de 4 Gribeauval, medium Canon de 8 Gribeauval and the heavy Canon de 12 Gribeauval.
Triplets:<Obusier
3:
--------------------
Text: Obusier de 6 pouces Gribeauval:  Superseding the older Vallière system, the Gribeauval system was introduced in 1765 and the guns were first used during the American Revolutionary War.
Triplets:<Obusier de 6 pouces Gribeauval
